Package ElectronicAssetTradingPlatform.AssetTrading

Class OrganisationalUnit

java.lang.Object
ElectronicAssetTradingPlatform.AssetTrading.OrganisationalUnit
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class OrganisationalUnit
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
Class for the organisational units which are individual departments in the organisation e.g. Human Resources or Management or Public Relations etc. These are the organisational units in which the users will belong in, and will use their unit's assets and credits to perform exchanges on this platform.
See Also:
Serialized Form

      credits - A float amount of total credits the organisational unit is to be initialised with

      public OrganisationalUnit​(java.lang.String name, float credits, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> assets)
      Constructor for an organisational unit that sets the constructor's parameter's into the local storage.
      Parameters:
      name - A string name of the organisational unit to be initialised
      credits - A float amount of total credits the organisational unit is to be initialised with
      assets - A hashmap collection of string and integers of the assets owned by the organisational unit

  • Method Details

    • addCredits

      public void addCredits​(float credits)
      Adds a given amount of credits onto the existing credits that the organisational unit already has.
      Parameters:
      credits - A float amount of credits to add to the existing credits of the organisational unit

    • removeCredits

      public void removeCredits​(float credits) throws LessThanZeroException
      Removes a given amount of credits from the existing credits that the organisational unit owns.
      Parameters:
      credits - A float amount of credits to be removed from the organisational unit
      Throws:
      LessThanZeroException - An exception to handle the total amount of credits of the organisational unit being less than zero disallowing the given amount of credits to be removed

    • addAsset

      public void addAsset​(java.lang.String assetName, int amountToAdd)
      Given a name and an amount to add, an asset will be added to the organisational unit's assets owned collection. If the organisational unit already owns the specified asset, the quantity to add will be added onto the currently existing total amount of that asset, otherwise a new asset with the specified amount will be added.
      Parameters:
      assetName - A string name of the asset/s to be added or added to
      amountToAdd - An integer amount of assets to add to the asset

    • removeAsset

      public void removeAsset​(java.lang.String assetName, int amountToRemove) throws MissingAssetException, LessThanZeroException
      Given a name and an amount to remove, the asset will be removed from the organisational unit's assets owned collection. If the asset to be removed is not found to be owned by the organisational unit, then an exception will be thrown detailing that. If the organisational unit does not own more assets than the amount of assets to be removed, then an exception will be also be thrown detailing this. If the amount of assets to be removed is equal to the amount the organisational unit currently owns, then the asset will be completely removed from the organisational unit meaning they will no longer own any quantities of this asset.
      Parameters:
      assetName - A string name of the asset/s to be removed
      amountToRemove - An integer amount of assets to be removed from the asset or be completely removed
      Throws:
      MissingAssetException - An exception to handle the event that the queried asset name is not currently owned by the organisational unit
      LessThanZeroException - An exception to handle the removal of more assets than the organisational unit currently owns

    • editName

      public void editName​(java.lang.String name)
      A setter function to edit the name of the organisational unit.
      Parameters:
      name - A string name to change the organisational unit's name to

    • removeAllAssets

      public void removeAllAssets()
      A method to remove all the assets that the organisational unit currently owns.

    • getCredits

      public float getCredits()
      A getter function to retrieve and return the total amount of credits the organisational unit currently owns.
      Returns:
      The total amount of credits that the organisational unit owns

    • getUnitName

      A getter function that retrieves and returns the name of the organisational unit.
      Returns:
      The name of the organisational unit

    • getAssetsOwned

      public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> getAssetsOwned()
      A getter function for retrieving and returning all the assets that the organisational unit currently owns.
      Returns:
      A map containing all the assets and their amounts in which this organisational unit currently owns

    • getAssetQuantity

      public int getAssetQuantity​(java.lang.String assetName)
      A getter function for retrieving and returning the amount of a specific singular asset given the name of the asset to query.
      Parameters:
      assetName - A string name of the asset to return the amount of that asset
      Returns:
      Return the quantity amount of the asset queried
